meanings.definition: To defeat or surpass in a game or competition by playing better.
meanings.sent1: She was outplaying her opponent in chess, making strategic moves to win.
meanings.sent2: The soccer team outplayed their rivals, scoring multiple goals effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The cat was outplaying the mouse in a playful game of chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: His skills in outplaying his opponents were like a master musician outshining amateurs.
meanings.sent5: The student outplaying others in the spelling bee stood out with flawless spelling.

meanings.definition: To perform better than someone else in a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: He was outplaying his classmates in the math competition, solving problems quickly.
meanings.sent2: The singer outplayed all others in the talent show with her beautiful voice.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outplaying the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to outplaying her rivals was like a shining star in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The athlete outplaying his opponents in the race crossed the finish line first.
